parameter-group.name: transformations
parameter-group.label: Transform values
parameter-group.description: These configuration parameters allow you to alter a value before it is published to MQTT or before a received value is assigned to an item.

parameter.name: stateTopic
parameter.label: MQTT state topic
parameter.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the channel will be state-less command-only channel.

parameter.name: commandTopic
parameter.label: MQTT command topic
parameter.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.

parameter.name: transformationPattern
parameter.label: Incoming value transformations
parameter.description:
Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}.
You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character âˆ©.

parameter.name: transformationPatternOut
parameter.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameter.description:
Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value.
Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.

parameter.name: formatBeforePublish
parameter.label: Outgoing value format
parameter.description:
Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state.
If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".

parameter.name: retained
parameter.label: Retained
parameter.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.

parameter.name: postCommand
parameter.label: Is command
parameter.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.

parameter.name: min
parameter.label: Absolute minimum
parameter.description: This configuration represents the minimum of the allowed range. For a percentage channel that equals zero percent.

parameter.name: max
parameter.label: Absolute maximum
parameter.description: This configuration represents the maximum of the allowed range. For a percentage channel that equals one-hundred percent.

parameter.name: step
parameter.label: Delta value
parameter.description: A number/dimmer channel can receive INCREASE/DECREASE commands and computes the target number by adding or subtracting this delta value.
